Generation I.Red: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke . Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke . Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
Generation I.Yellow: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake champion swimmers.
Generation I.Stadium: A strong swimmer, it is faster than a human champ in an individual medley. It can go far and fast with minimal breathing.

Generation II.Gold: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
Generation II.Silver: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
Generation II.Crystal: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
Generation II.Stadium 2: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Poliwrath 's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pok é mon can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
Generation III.Sapphire: Poliwrath 's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pok é mon can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
Generation III.Emerald: Its highly developed muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. This Pok é mon can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
Generation III.FireRed: An adept swimmer, it knows the front crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster than the best human swimmers.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

Generation IV.Diamond: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation IV.Pearl: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation IV.Platinum: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation IV.HeartGold: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.

Generation V.Black: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation V.White: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation V.Black 2: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation V.White 2: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

Generation VI.X: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation VI.Y: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.

Generation VII.Sun: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
Generation VII.Moon: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It's quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The muscles it has developed through swimming are thick and powerful. When it lands a square punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
Generation VIII.Shield: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: With its extremely tough muscles, it could keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: With its extremely tough muscles, it could keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Although it's skilled in a style of dynamic swimming that uses all its muscles, for some reason it lives on dry land.
Generation IX.Violet: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.

Generation V.Black: Wellspring Cave , Challenger's Cave , Victory Road , and Giant Chasm ( Fishing in rippling water )
Generation V.White: Wellspring Cave , Challenger's Cave , Victory Road , and Giant Chasm ( Fishing in rippling water )
Generation V.Black 2: Route 23 , Relic Passage , Clay Tunnel , Wellspring Cave , Giant Chasm , and Victory Road * ( Fishing in rippling water )
Generation V.White 2: Route 23 , Relic Passage , Clay Tunnel , Wellspring Cave , Giant Chasm , and Victory Road * ( Fishing in rippling water )
